title: @RiotRepertoir about Diana
body:
Hello, I would like to ask you for your opinion about Diana's current state.
Is she an assassin, or is she a fighter?

If she is an assassin, then how come she gets a shield and a DOT on her W (it takes time for W to deal full damage, it's not instant, so it's a DOT) and her E brings enemies around her closer, while dealing no damage (meaning enemies will be closer to her, and be able to deal damage faster)

If she is not an assassin, then how come she gets to have this much burst (on par, or even bigger than some assassins)

Overall Diana is really strong, and in need of balancing, or a rework (nerfs in this patch most definitely)

Thank you.

replies.body:
> Is she an assassin, or is she a fighter?

I wouldn't say she's really one or the other, but more a hybrid of both. As far as assassin elements go, she has pretty good backline access and up-front burst, but she's not very slippery and doesn't really have outs or defensive tricks that many assassins do.  On the fighter side of things, her sustained damage is quite high, but, even considering her shield, she doesn't get quite as tanky and doesn't operate quite as effectively with dedicated tanky builds.

These elements result in her having a very all-in playstyle, and makes her pretty snowbally as well. She is pretty powerful, but I don't think at this point there's a definitive argument to be made that she's too far out of line at the moment.
She feels like another version of akali when you lane with her, the only difference being she gets a shield and has some CC

Yes, she doesn't have escapes. That is in part why I think she was not meant to be an assassin.

On another note, I love how everyone likes to point out that AD assassins can auto attack. But why no one ever points out, that AP assassins can use {{item:3157}} ? It's the most stupid broken active in the game, and it's really not fair that one side gets to use it, and the other one does not, and has no similar item.

From someone who played Diana a lot, I don't believe she has been at the patch notes in a fairly long time. I think some bug fixes on the Q/R reset and a faster rotating speed on W (which was a surprisingly nice change). Aside from that, her real strength comes from Runeglaive smoothing out her item path by giving her a little bit of everything she needs and letting her hit her midgame power spike faster. She's in a good state right now but her strength relies completely on the strength of runeglaive.
She is the only viable assasin with high burst and sustained dmg atm + she has a shitty laning vs ranged champion pre 6.

Guess what? Every melee champion ever has shitty laning vs ranged champs. And not only pre 6.

Assassins should not have both burst and sustained damage. Assassin's job is to go in, delete, and go out. Not go in, delete, go help delete another, and then delete another.
